p: Generally, viruses in water come from excretion in feces. Viruses can survive in fecal matter and in sewage water for up to 10 days. Very little information is currently available on the transmission of enveloped viruses via feco-oral transmission or through our sewer system. In case of the 2003 SARS outbreak, the human coronavirus was found in stool samples (Peiris et al. 2003). The urine samples have also shown human enveloped viruses such as the cytomegalovirus (CMV).
